page.title: 03GIBBET HILL
page.content: GIBBET HILL, 272 METRES ABOVE SEA LEVEL, IS THE SECOND HIGHEST POINT IN SURREY AND THE HIGHEST IN HINDHEAD. IT IS AN IMPORTANT FEATURE IN LOCAL HISTORY. GIBBET HILL GAINED ITS NOTORIETY AS A RESULT OF A MURDER COMITTED NEARBY IN I786. AN UNNAMED SAILOR WALKING BETWEEN LONDON AND PORTSMOUTH WAS BEFRIENDED BY THREE PENNILESS SAILORS. THE UNNAMED SAILOR AGREED TO TREAT THEM TO FOOD AND DRINK AT THE RED LION INN, THURSLEY.NEAR THE DEVIL'S PUNCHBOWL, THE THREE SAILORS SET UPON THE UNKNOWN SAILOR, BEAT HIM AND ROBBED HIM.HOWEVER, TWO LABOURERS WHO HAD BEEN FOLLOWING THEM ALONG THE ROAD, SAW THE SAILOR'S BODY AND GUESSING WHO THE MURDERERS WERE FOLLOWED THEM TO SHEET, NEAR PETERSFIELD. THE SUSPECTS WERE FOUND GUILTY AND HANGED ON GIBBET HILL.
